TextBlock.TextLine: Antwarp 3 fub 1682
London mo John Loy
S. my last to you was on the 10h past, sende non from 4 on y0 bals of lyched
18 londen aboard of haulatsoy att Bhenge S, which is not rest dipaited for wantes
good mind, as I supost in Ravharl oools schall ha advises you & intth
bill of loading f have made you onely debtor for the fiest coot, & hoe
you will allove inu comethiny to the cbarges, wuch £20 sertt 10 yo
dise resion, whilst Pexe inclosed send y0. acctt the ballance of which is
£211:16 flmists phics this day SPave dearor on you att 35„2 att 2 p
in my bile of £120:0:t ts payable to the bedee of mr. Jacorno Paupens
sor ulerp rec. of hunm, so ies ray oe due honne puc
chall advise you att large of yd yaeme, expecting some moen sunbout
of tycke maken to touvene, to sine you a full information whilst nows
& remaine
Antroarp 3 feb 1682
Londen Der Luoy Kurght ley
my last so you oas ou the 14: past, whick I Rope you han och
de ceraped as also of 3:t ditto thouigs & haue sence noufiour yous
hope that no indisuartion bats ditanned yo ausswse of rooich I long to
midoistand, because I nould faime enero if of hare to expat the 1 aucoirs you
Bad tead y for nmee, to foucem my self accoeding pray dispose of 1ed heisis
I can do n0 good nitts them Beyv: on the 26. part Bath of 6r11 heve suche
a storme & violent water flood, that itt broacke in all the lands here about &
lower towands the sea, which hath dravnded 33 polders from iddill tot his towne
mined sever all forts, and al most all the towne of stultt, such that never the like
was heard, or seen, the loss is Infinite great, god comfort all loos2s
a 3d.
London mr. Abram Vivian
mij last to you was on the 27 past, sence non from you yett, whilst you leave mee
not a little, straightned for mony to diicharge yd bill on the 31 past, have drowne ou
m. Tiongio Coles £72- att 1½ ito for yd. acctt att 35& 3 ½ payable to the ord of in
Josegh Sabberton for the valew of m. ignatius clay, to which tray take care that
all due honour begeven, & in case grecave no news from you shall draw att least
£200 more, for I can nott bitlp, or avod itt, I am yett no less then £400-
in disburse on yd acctt. which followesh nept saturday, Interim you have heere
inclosen the acctt of sale of the last yeare, which are in all ƒ 40972: 16¼
in f. £6828:16„1½ in which yo ½ is £3414„ 8„0 ¾, as you shall see on yd
acctt this yeares charges are £489„18.3 in which yd ½ is £244 „19„1½, & the
resting goods cost fust penine £1771:- so that you will finde the profitt in all
£500- stt, & of the last yeare £200 -, so that I rekon sence wee dealt togheter
oon the wholen about £700- st proffitt which you will see cleares whesn you
have the acctt of clharges & yor cur., pray faile not to sand my acctt & sett
mee know how itt is whit the bayes in orderd, for I do much want them, of alsoo
to know if you intend to come over & when, to take my measures accordingley for
I love not to bo backward, when theres comes demand, wat ever you do, lett not
mij bill suster bij m. Cole
C 3 feb 1682
Londen Mr. Beorge Cole
In antwers to yd of the 9 past to send here inclosed the acctt curr of the astate of J.N.
de seased, of which I finde due to that efrate £150:18„1½ flemish which is most standing
ont by bohfail d Coninck, abram van dist, and the vidond formentrond & othere, I
shall endeavour to yett itt in this month to remitt itt you, whilst I shall prefare a
discharge to besigned by you & the other exceutoins for mee, pray examine this, & lett
mee know if you finde any thing to yd on my preiudice: pray lett mee have the desred
attastatin of daniel vivian. I have made bold the 31 past to pass my bill on you
for £72- att 1½ 13 payable to the order of m. Joseph Sabberron for the valeu
of m. Ignatius Clay, which pray give due honour, & pats to acctt. of m. abram vivian
I could not avoid itt, beeng some what straightned to pay the bills you drew for him
so I hope you will not take itt ill, neither refuse my bill, for I should suster vere much
by itt, & if you please not to accept itt for his acct, pray do itt for mine and I'll see
you satisfied boath for the valew & sromble I putt you to to depend here on to yo discresion
Ifyon draw on mee the £50- od mony for m. Lobb & Comp. shall duely discharge you, &
In all occasions, where in I can senve you, bee gladd to have yd commandes
3d
London mr. Heny Maynard
I hope yd safe arrivall in London, & that noting hath hindered yd passage though
here wee have hadd such stormes, and floods, as never the like did happen, betwixf
middelbourgh & this place, are 73 polders drownded which is al most as much ground
as all brabant by which every one will suster att the other side the frenck will nott defist
in their pretentions so that wee are menaced on all sides, which I doubt will give us no
trade nevertheless, in hopes of a better, then the present constitutin doth promise send you
here inclosed the neassary instanckens, for what I iudge needfull to assort our ware
house, which you pleases to gett ready as soone as possible & send forward according
to the best exontiumite, principaly one pack of the keys p first, as alsoo the northres
goods, which is all will wnoth is still here, because wee daibt, & as much wee understand
sprong is underwater, so shall not send him forward till wee have trev advise
a 4p
Brugge nmr. Raphael Coots
In antw. aen den ul van p. deser, heeft ul hier beneffens de noodige certificatie, dat ul voortaen
separate reeq over de toecomende packen sal maecken, sal aeng wesen. het stormende weder
a 4d.
Rechelen Juff anna Nigans
den ul van gisteren ontf het stuckeken cant sal houden, dogh verwondere mij dat ul mij niet en
seght, oft ul de st van H baiet can leevere, waer op dan antw verwaghte is 't saecken
dat m. van Aken geen occasie heeft en ul gelt te bett. sal het selve op ul order gereet houden
den sack van mijn swager hebbe niet vernomen, waghte ul antwe
a 4di
Mechelen Juff. anna van deneden
m. van Aken heeft mijn gelt met de bode aen mij gesonden, ter wijlen dat cusf wigans op den
wegh was, maer t sedert heeft hij hier geweest, & mij geseyt dat hij in weijnige dagen alhier
nogh gelt soude hebben, soo hebbe dan de somme voor ul aen hem p memaie gegeeven, cant
het hem gelegen hij magh het ul bes soo niet soo is ul gelt niet sij mij gereet
Ick Meyne dat Icq ul hadde geseyt van 6 a 8 st van ½ a briet de spiefel geront & d'ander
stock gront, heeft ul eenige gelieft mij die te seynden, ofte adviseeren, wanner ul die can
leeveren 3 sij 3. 4. 5 a6 grvolgens gelegentheyt
